title: Classic Mono Serif
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Extract_6599.png)

Hi everyone,

I'm looking for the name of this font (a kind of classic mono serif). It comes from a little french book without any credits…

Thanks by advance.

Greetings from Paris,  
GG

Font: 

 Delegate (from IBM Selectric typewriter) 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ClassicMonoSerif.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/typophile.com/files/ClassicMonoSerif.png) | 467.04 KB |
author: ggrall

comments.content:
Do you have any idea when the book was printed? If it's within the last couple of decades it might be worth trying to track down a clean light weight digital typewriter. IIRC there are some possibles that are not at Myfonts.  
Don

Hi Don, Thanks for your reply. The book was printed in France in 1984… [http://www.mfj.gr.jp/publications/mfj/iki\_no\_kozo\_structure\_de\_liki/inde...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.mfj.gr.jp/publications/mfj/iki_no_kozo_structure_de_liki/index.php "http://www.mfj.gr.jp/publications/mfj/iki\_no\_kozo\_structure\_de\_liki/index.php") Maybe the text was really typewrited ?

Yes, in 1984 some books were typed on an IBM Selectric typewriter, or a similar good quality typewriter from another source and the results were photographed for printing. Note the handwritten Greek phrase.  
We can check the design against some of the popular typefaces used on IBM "elements" -- the thing that looks like a golfball -- and see if it is digitized. They had names like \_courier\_, \_prestige\_, \_elite\_ etc.  
Here is a selection of these typefaces compiled by Luc Devroye [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-44934.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-44934.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-44934.html") If you can find some of the distinctive letters in the book, like \_Q\_, \_R\_, \_g\_ and \_3\_ it makes it easier to decide on a match.  
Don

Hi Don, thanks for your reply and for the link. A friend of mine found the font ! Like you say it comes from a IBM Selectric typewriter : it's called Delegate (look at the K, it matches : [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2425128/Screenshot%202014-10-02%20%C...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/https:/dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2425128/Screenshot%202014-10-02%20%C3%A0%2011.27.50.jpg "https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2425128/Screenshot%202014-10-02%20%C3%A0%2011.27.50.jpg") !). My friend says there is not clean digitized version of this font -- just this dirty free one : [http://www.azfonts.net/load\_font/delegate.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.azfonts.net/load_font/delegate.html "http://www.azfonts.net/load\_font/delegate.html") ! But some specimen exist, so we think about digitizing it in the future ;-)

Or this one called Triplicate by Matthew But­t­er­ick : [http://practicaltypography.com/triplicate.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/practicaltypography.com/triplicate.html "http://practicaltypography.com/triplicate.html")

Thanks Guillaume for the link to the Delegate specimen.  
I have fond memories of Delegate. It produced a presentation quality document with a subtle variation in stroke weight that made it much more attractive for publication than most typewriter typefaces.  
BTW Triplicate is well made, but it's rather different than the Delegate typeface for the Selectric.  
Don

Here is a list of reasonably well engineered monospace typewriter fonts at Myfonts, that could perhaps be substituted. None is a proper match for Delegate.

First, several fonts based on IBM'S Prestige for the Selectric  
Prestige Elite, several sellers including  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/prestige-elite/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/prestige-elite/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/prestige-elite/")  
Alix FB  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/alix-fb/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/alix-fb/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/alix-fb/")  
Prestige 12 Pitch, also based on IBM'S Prestige for the Selectric  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/prestige-12-pitch/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/prestige-12-pitch/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/prestige-12-pitch/")

Also-rans, in alphabetical order:  
Bulletin Typewriter  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/bulletin-typewriter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/bulletin-typewriter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/bulletin-typewriter/")  
EF Techno Script, apparently based on a Royal typewriter  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/bulletin-typewriter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/bulletin-typewriter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/bulletin-typewriter/")  
ITC American Typewriter, century old design  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-american-typewriter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-american-typewriter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-american-typewriter/")  
Italian Typewriter, Ollivetti circa 1940, more stylish than most  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flanker/italian-typewriter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flanker/italian-typewriter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flanker/italian-typewriter/")  
Remington Elite Typewriter  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/remington-elite-typewriter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/remington-elite-typewriter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/remington-elite-typewriter/")  
Remington Typewriter, with well designed Italic by Frederic Goudy  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-remington-typewriter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-remington-typewriter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-remington-typewriter/")  
Smith Premier, an old ATF design, as Smith Premier NF  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/smith-premier-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/smith-premier-nf/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/smith-premier-nf/")  
Tired of Courier  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/tiredofcourier/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/tiredofcourier/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/tiredofcourier/")  
Typewriter by Monotype, source unknown  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/typewriter-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/typewriter-mt/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/typewriter-mt/")  
Plus, perhaps of lesser quality, Intellecta Typewriter, old design  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/intellecta-typewriter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/intellecta-typewriter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/intellecta-typewriter/")  
Don

Just to clarify my previous post.  
My list of reasonably well engineered monospace typewriter fonts at Myfonts, that could perhaps be substituted for Delegate, was limited to fonts with a double story \_g\_. I did not include several similar quality fonts that have a single story \_g\_.  
Don

Hi Don, sorry for the delay of my reaction, and thanks you so much for your links.  
GG
